sourceOfFunds.purpose: Large scale production of quality plants of local orchids through tissue culture for the benefit of women self help groups and farmers and providing them the plant lets at a cheaper rate so that they can start their own production centre.

To produce quality planting materials at a large scale for commercially important local cultivars of banana through in vitro shoot tip culture. To transfer of technology from laboratory to common people through engaging women in the process of hardening. To standardize post harvest management practices of banana fruits for domestic market and commercialization of local banana among the growers and consumers.

Rapid production of tissue culture banana plants of local cultivars through shoot tip culture. Transfer of technology from lab to land by engaging women self help groups. Commercialization and popularization of tissue culture banana plants among the growers and consumers. Training and demonstration for women groups for skill development. Supply of plant materials at a cheaper rate to the women self help groups and farmers to develop their own production centre.
For attending and presenting a research paper in International Horticultural Congress 2014 , at Brisbane, Australia wef. 17th -22nd August, 2014.

In vitro multiplication of local orchids for popularization and commercialization. Involving women self help groups for hardening and nourishing of tissue culture orchid plants. Large scale production of tissue culture orchid plants and technology transfer from lab to land.

Rapid production of local orchids through in vitro micropropagation for community development. Engagement of women self help groups in rearing and hardening of tissue culture plants. Transfer of technology from lab to land by engaging women groups.Arrangement of training for rearing and cultivation of tissue culture orchids for their skill development. Supply of planting materials to farmers and growers at a cheaper rate.

Large scale production of pineapple through axillary bud culture through in vitro micro propagation. Vegetative propagation through in vivo sand culture. Arrangement of training for women groups for hardening of in vitro grown plants as well as cultivation practices for their skill development. As per sanction order, a sum of Rs 336636 spent from organization for construction of green and net house for hardening of tissue culture plants.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Radiance Society was initiated in December; 2006 on 7th. The Radiance Society is formally registered under the Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 on 19th February 2007. Regd. No.  UDGI/262/A/22 of 2007. The Radiance Societys objective is to help build a Socio-Economic development sector which can effectively work for the poorest people.

The Radiance Society believes that there is a need for competent partnerships to develop which can work for the poorest and most marginalized people. The Radiance Society is running a education institute at Dimakuchi by own fund.
Radiance Society fund raised from own Tea Garden.

Vision: A Radiance Society based on legitimate rights, equity, justice, honesty, social sensitivity and a culture of service in which all are self-dependable. Mission: To identify, work and savings along the economically and socially deprived the physically and mentally challenged-starting with children and poorest people, so that they become educated, skilled and aware. Enable them to be self-dependable and enjoy a healthy, dignified and sustainable quality of life.

detailsOfAchievement: Achievement Reports: (a) Reproductive & Child Health (Mother NGO) RCH : As MNGO RCH phase I under MOHFW,GOI since 99/2000-2005 implemented in 5 Districts Viz-Kamrup, Nalbari, Barpeta, Goalpara & Bongaigaon. Total financial Assistance received Rs. 1.16 Crore during 5 years. Continued in phase II RCH since 2006 to 2009 received Rs. 96.00 Lac for 3 years in two District-Nalbari & Barpeta implemented through CBO,FNGOs of respective Districts. The Achievement indications are as (In last 3 years) PW registration 26.4 % to 63.11 %. ANC Coverage 14.83 % to 87.1 %. Institutional Delivery 16.21 % to 67.1 % PNC Coverage 17.8 % to 65.58 % Immunization 27.65 % to 87.17 % (b) IEC project under Deptt. of AYUSH, MOHFW, through FNGO in Kamrup & Barpeta Dist- Rs. 50 Lacs during last 5 years & Health camp 34 Nos Rs. 50 lac Financial Assistance received from the Ministry. Community Awareness, Education & Treatment of common ailments through AYUSH system. (c) Community Health & Family Welfare: Mobile Health checkup & Treatment in Malaria affected Area, Awareness Campaign on Cancer, TB, Blindness, Pulse Polio programme, Safe drinking water, Sanitation etc. (d) TI Project on HIV AIDS under ASACS : TI Project on IDU at Golaghat & Truckers Project at Golaghat/Nagaon Dist. continuously last 6 years worked for prevention of HIV-AIDS in the above Core Sectors. (e) Handicraft Sector: Promotion, Marketing, Research on Handicraft, Organizing expos, Exhibitions & participation in Melas, Exhibitions etc. Having a production cum training centre on handicrafts at Khetri and a craft development centre at Majuli. (f) Social Forestry Project under NAEB, Ministry of National Forest and Environment Board : The Project under MOH&FW ,New Delhi, Follow-up activities were carried out in the project site Fatashil Ambari Reserve Forest for community Management of plant sampling Rs. 6 Lac yearly. (g) CAPART MoRD Project: Organizing Gramshree Mela, Workshop etc. at Guwahati. Women in Agriculture : The Organization continued the following up Activities among 30 Nos SHG of Dimoria,Rani & Kamalpur Block- Micro credit linkage etc. (h) Youth Development Projects under MOYAS, GOI. Trained for 6 months & adolescent camp for 3 installments Rs. 50 Lac financial Assistance received. (i) Women Empowerment in legal, income generation, Health, Agril & allied, Handloom, Handicrafts, Social Welfare issues. (j) Project on People with disabilities in Morigaon District. A UK Govt. project through SANCHAR, KOLKATA 4 years Project. (k) Many welfare activities, like help the destitute boys like SOS rehabilitation, Served the marooned people at the time- Flood, Natural Calamities, Medicine distribution relief materials distribution etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Community Action for Health is a key strategy of the National Health Mission (NHM), which places people at the centre of the process to ensure their health needs and rights are being fulfilled. It allows them to monitor the progress of the NHM interventions regularly in their areas resulting in active community participation and contribution towards strengthening health services.
